result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Ciszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders a DV surcharge.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment. You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
with credit for 299 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation.

Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with treatment if determined by the the DOC. 
Defendant to undergo drug treatment recommended by the DOC.
The court does not order sex offender reporting.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Ciszewski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 299 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation. Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with treatment if determined by the the DOC.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant to undergo drug treatment recommended by the DOC.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.  The court does not order sex offender reporting. 
Court orders a DV surcharge.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Karshen is in trial in another court.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Jennifer Williams for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Mental Harm to a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.04(1), a Felony.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Defendant must registar as a sex offender.  

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Michael J Ciszewski not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant may be entering a plea on trial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Bail remains the same.

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are working towards a resolution and request a projected plea and sentencing date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/24/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Motion In Limine Filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions Filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.
List of Witnesses Filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.
Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program. Order for Supervision, Received and Filed

Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 6/01/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of 08/01/15 this matter will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Michael J Ciszewski not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. Due to the scheduling of the attorneys and the lateness of the hour, Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Attorney Harris has recently been appointed in this matter and has not received discovery from prior counsel. Arguments heard as to bail. Court DENIED defense motion. Court added the following condition to Justice Point monitoring: No driving. Court granted defense request for adjourned scheduling date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Michael J Ciszewski not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel made oral motion to withdraw as counsel of record due to a conflict with the Public Defender's Office. State takes no position. Court granted defense counsel's request and allowed attorney McCandless to withdraw. Defendant to be produced for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.L.H. (3/29/98).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael J Ciszewski in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
